_prev_prog_2.PC_OtherType: Administrative controls (operation procedures in place, speed limit, etc.), load-out riser breakaway system and remote manual shutoff valves.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan-Executive Summary


Facility:  Mo Valley Agri-Service of Atchison County, Inc.	
   17800 US Hwy 136 West
   Rock Port, MO 64482
Contact: Mike Herron	
Phone:   660-744-5325

1.	Facility Policy.
The owners, management and employees of Mo Valley Agri-Service of Atchison County, Inc., Watson, MO location are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, Atchison   County LEPC, and/or other authorities, to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the people and the environment.

2.	Facility Information.

The primary activity at the facility is the distribution of products to farmers.  The fertilizer product, anhydrous ammonia is received, stored and distributed for direct application as a nutrient for crop production.  At times, for short periods, the nurse tanks on site maybe filled to approximately 85% capacity.  The nurse tanks are designed for the purpose of containing anhydrous ammonia.    This anhydrous ammonia facility is in operation of receiving and distributing product only on a seasonal basis (approximately three months of the year), the balance of the year it is used for storage of product. 
3.	The Worst-Case Release Scenario and the Alternate Release Scenario 

An analysis of the potential off-site consequences of hypothetical worst-case and alternative-case accidental releases have been addressed in our Hazard Assessment and information is in our Risk Management Program.

4.	Accidental Release Prevention Program

The facility is in compliance with the provisions of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia" and state regulations covering anhydrous ammonia.  The OSHA standard is referenced in this RMP Registration Form; see Section 8.3 (b).  In the event of an accidental release or emergency i

t is the policy of Mo Valley Agri-Service of Atchison County, Inc. employees to immediately dial 911 to notify local emergency services.  

5.	Five-Year Accident History.

There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia while under our operation.  There was an accident in the past five years that have caused injuries and significant property damage at the facility.

6.	Emergency Action Plan.

          The facility has:

           a.     A written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard
                   29 CFR 1910.38;

           b.     Provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and
                   Community right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III
                  (EPCRA);

           c.     If a large release of anhydrous ammonia takes place at the facility,
                   the required response action is to evacuate the area of the spill and
                   call 911 and all applicable emergency response numbers listed in our
                   Emergency Action Plan.

7.	Planned Changes to Improve Safety.

Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility.  Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the conditions at our facility.   There are no additional specific safety recommendations regarding storage or use of anhydrous ammonia for implementation at this time.
